questions.clue: This ancient civilization is known for its pyramids and pharaohs.
In 1215, this document was signed, limiting the powers of the English king.
This U.S. president issued the Emancipation Proclamation in 1863.
This battle, fought in 1066, marked the beginning of Norman rule in England.
This treaty ended World War I and imposed heavy reparations on Germany.
This force keeps planets in orbit around the sun.
This gas is essential for human respiration and makes up about 21% of the Earth's atmosphere.
This basic unit of life is the smallest structural and functional unit of an organism.
The process by which plants convert sunlight into chemical energy is known as this.
This branch of science deals with the study of matter and energy and their interactions.
This author wrote the famous play 'Romeo and Juliet'.
This novel features a young orphan named Pip and his growth from childhood to adulthood.
In this dystopian novel by George Orwell, the phrase 'Big Brother is watching you' is a central theme.
This American author is known for his short stories, particularly 'The Tell-Tale Heart' and 'The Fall of the House of Usher'.
This epic poem, attributed to Homer, tells the story of Odysseus's ten-year journey home after the Trojan War.
This is the largest continent on Earth, known for its diverse cultures and languages.
This river is the longest in the world, flowing over 4,000 miles through northeastern Africa.
This mountain range, which includes Mount Everest, separates Asia from Europe.
This country is home to both the Sahara Desert and the Nile River.
This archipelago nation consists of over 17,000 islands, making it the largest island country in the world.
This iconic superhero, known for his red cape and 'S' symbol, first appeared in Action Comics #1 in 1938.
This pop star is known for hits like 'Shake It Off' and 'Blank Space', and has won multiple Grammy Awards.
The long-running animated series created by Matt Groening features a yellow family living in Springfield.
This film series featuring the character Katniss Everdeen is based on a trilogy of novels by Suzanne Collins.
This British band, known for albums like 'The Dark Side of the Moon', has been influential in the rock genre since the 1960s.
